Package com.penthera.virtuososdk.client

Interface ISegment

  • public interface ISegment
    Interface to individual segments. A segment is one file of a segmented (e.g. HLS, HSS) asset.
    For example usage: ISegmentedAsset.
    See Also:
    ISegmentedAsset

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double getContentLength()
      Returns the content-length value provided by the remote server when download begins.
      double getCurrentSize()
      Current size of the segment on disk
      Bundle getCustomHeaders()
      Retrieve the custom HTTP headers registered against this segment.
      int getDownloadStatus()
      Current download state of the segment
      double getExpectedSize()
      Expected size of this segment, in bytes
      The expected size is initially set to -1.
      String getFilePath()
      Absolute path where this segment lives on disk
      int getId()
      ID of this segment
      int getLastStatusCode()
      Last known HTTP status code from downloading this segment
      String getParentUuid()
      UUID of the parent asset container that owns this segment
      String getRemotePath()
      Remote URL where this segment is being downloaded from
      boolean isEncryptionSegment()
      Whether this is an encryption segment
      Virtuoso treats encryption keys and data just like any other segment.
      boolean isPending()
      Whether this segment has completed download.
      void setCustomHeaders​(Bundle headers)
      Set custom HTTP headers for this segment.

    • Method Detail

      • getParentUuid

        String getParentUuid()
        UUID of the parent asset container that owns this segment
        Returns:
        Parent's UUID

      • getId

        int getId()
        ID of this segment
        Returns:
        ID

      • getFilePath

        String getFilePath()
        Absolute path where this segment lives on disk
        Returns:
        Path. If this segment hasn't yet been downloaded, or is outside of the parent's availability window, null is returned.

      • getRemotePath

        String getRemotePath()
        Remote URL where this segment is being downloaded from
        Returns:
        Remote URL

      • getExpectedSize

        double getExpectedSize()
        Expected size of this segment, in bytes
        The expected size is initially set to -1.
        When Virtuoso starts to download this segment, it sets this value to what the remote server reports in the content-length header.
        Returns:
        Expected size in bytes

      • getCurrentSize

        double getCurrentSize()
        Current size of the segment on disk
        Returns:
        Current size in bytes

      • getContentLength

        double getContentLength()
        Returns the content-length value provided by the remote server when download begins. Returns -1 if Virtuoso has not yet fetched the content-length value.
        Returns:
        Size of the asset, in bytes, or -1 if the download hasn't started yet

      • isPending

        boolean isPending()
        Whether this segment has completed download. This is a convenience method that is equivalent to checking the download status for completion.
        Returns:
        False if fully downloaded

      • getDownloadStatus

        int getDownloadStatus()
        Current download state of the segment
        Returns:
        Download status
        See Also:
        Common.AssetStatus

      • isEncryptionSegment

        boolean isEncryptionSegment()
        Whether this is an encryption segment
        Virtuoso treats encryption keys and data just like any other segment.
        An encryption segment points to the encryption key that must be downloaded.
        Returns:
        True if this is an encryption segment

      • setCustomHeaders

        void setCustomHeaders​(Bundle headers)
        Set custom HTTP headers for this segment.
        Virtuoso will use these headers as part of the GET request when downloading this segment.
        These headers are applied after the parent's custom headers, and thus take precedence in case of conflict.
        Parameters:
        headers - A bundle specifying the headers to be applied for this segment (key/value pairs).

      • getCustomHeaders

        Bundle getCustomHeaders()
        Retrieve the custom HTTP headers registered against this segment.
        Returns:
        The custom HTTP headers, or null if none have been set

      • getLastStatusCode

        int getLastStatusCode()
        Last known HTTP status code from downloading this segment
        Returns:
        Last response code or 0
